description: After an all-night debate at Bar 101, Rada Miskovic chooses action over exposure, deciding to trigger the BCI blackout script and give the city a taste of algorithm-free life.

Rada and a trusted group of engineers launch the blackout script. All BCI functions across Stenograd abruptly cease, leaving transport, services, and housing access in the hands of local communities and manual oversight.

Residents quickly organize temporary committees, set up mutual aid, and establish local rules as trust and old tensions are both tested. Chaos is limited by grassroots collaboration, but some conflicts flare up.
With BCI down, the 'invisible' citizen network circulates a manifesto detailing Council-ordered erasures and calls for collective reform, igniting public debate on future governance.

BCI resumes, applying a new scoring logic: citizens who helped others or led constructively see higher scores, while those associated with the old order lose privileges. This shift sparks citywide calls for leadership renewal.
